description.narrative: UN-Habitat har ett unikt FN-mandat att arbeta med stadsutvecklings-frågor globalt & urbanisering i utvecklingsländer och dess effekter. Idag bor minst 850 miljoner människor i slum och det beräknas finnas 3 miljarder sluminvånare 2050. Slumsituationen är ohållbar både för hälsa och miljö. Sida ger programstöd med särskild uppföljning om fysisk planering, mark, slumsäkerhet & övergripande

UN-Habitat has a unique UN-mandate to work with urban development globally & urbanization and its effects. Today, at least 850 million people live slum & 3 billion slum dwellers are expected 2050. Slumsituation is untenable both for health and environment. Sida gives program support with special attention to physical planning, land, slum security and fund management/transparancy.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative:
General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2015Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: UN-Habitat's achievements in relation to the agreed results framework exceed expectations in some areas and does not meet target on a few. Reported results are equivalent to expectations on most indicators. Overall, it is Sida's assessment that UN-Habitat's achievements on the results framework is satisfactory.
The main positive highlights was (a) the implementation of results-based management principles on all Habitats activities; (b) the number of evidence-based initiatives of/ with other UN agencies contributing to the promotion of sustainable urban development; (c) the number of partner local and national authorities that have adopted local crime prevention strategies. It is also specfically valuable to mention that nine partner metropolitan, regional and national authorities have adopted national urban policies or spatial frameworks that support compact, integrated and connected cities
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
